{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3738213,"name":"Anthony Cavero","username":"antigro09","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/8edcca/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-12T13:30:26.768Z","cooked":"

Recently, my team has been playing around with the Jetson Orin, but we can’t seem to get it to power on when connected to the robot. I am trying to get around 19v so we can use its MAXN SUPER mode, which takes in about 40w, so we can maximize performance. Does anyone have any advice on how to achieve this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-09-12T13:30:26.768Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":167,"readers_count":166,"score":113.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506251,"topic_slug":"powering-jetson-orin-nano","display_username":"Anthony Cavero","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76769,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/powering-jetson-orin-nano/506251/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3738319,"name":"Bryson Halsey","username":"Bryson_Halsey","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/ecd19e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-12T15:48:37.478Z","cooked":"

Currently we use this to power our OPIs but it should work for a Jetson as well, the boost rail goes up to 24V

The Thrifty Bot

Grapple Robotics MitoCANdria

Powered by Grapple Robotics, the MitoCANdria lives up to its name as the powerhouse of the robot, providing reliable and clean power distribution where it matters most. Its innovative dual-phase design efficiently converts input voltage to both a...

Price: USD 149.99

We used this buck convertor to power our Jetson on our 2025 robot: Amazon.com

We found that the 5a version wouldn’t allow the jetson to boot properly all the time, so we upgraded to a 10a and didnt see any issues.

We used these carrier boards as well ( https://www.seeedstudio.com/reComputer-J401-Carrier-Board-for-Jetson-Orin-NX-Orin-Nano-p-5636.html ), but had issues with the barrel jack and ended up removing the barrel jack and soldering the power wires directly to the board.

We just tested it out, and with a multimeter we got a steady output stream of 12v so it works but when plugged in, it did not power on. What issues did you have exactly with the barrel jack?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-09-17T02:25:41.891Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":75,"readers_count":74,"score":25.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506251,"topic_slug":"powering-jetson-orin-nano","display_username":"Anthony Cavero","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":30485,"username":"WillCaradonna","name":"WillCaradonna","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/willcaradonna/{size}/129404_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76769,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/powering-jetson-orin-nano/506251/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3741193,"name":"WillCaradonna","username":"WillCaradonna","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/willcaradonna/{size}/129404_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-17T14:29:35.490Z","cooked":"

Its not uncommon for barrel jacks to become loose over time, especially if you are using a single spring barrel jack. We would have intermittent power dropouts with the robot would hit stuff/ general driving.

Alternately you could hot glue the barrel jack in, but that’s less robust then replacing it.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-09-17T14:29:35.490Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":59,"readers_count":58,"score":21.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506251,"topic_slug":"powering-jetson-orin-nano","display_username":"WillCaradonna","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":76769,"username":"antigro09","name":"Anthony Cavero","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/8edcca/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30485,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 67, Design Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/powering-jetson-orin-nano/506251/5","custom_user_title":"FRC 67, Design Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3742472,"name":"Anthony Cavero","username":"antigro09","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/8edcca/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-19T03:24:45.933Z","cooked":"

Alright. At first we had trouble powering it but we found out it was because the barrel jack was 26 awg and couldn’t support the current. We ended up using this one: 16 awg barrel jack. It turned on and could run our april tag and object detection pipeline really well!
